title: Virgin Galactic, Bitcoin, Moderna, Goldman: What to Watch in the Stock Market Today; Virgin Galactic shares were on a descent trajectory; Backing for Moderna's booster gave the stock a shot in the arm
text:
* Goldman Sachs reported higher profit and revenue in the third quarter, benefiting from a bevy of deals.

* Supply-chain management company J.B. Hunt Transport Services reported a 59% rise in third-quarter profit as all of the company's segments pushed revenue above market expectations in the period.

* PNC Financial Services reported a profit decline as costs from a merger raised non-interest expenses.

* Billionaire investor Carl Icahn on Thursday escalated his challenge to Nevada utility Southwest Gas by offering to buy shares and announcing plans to try to replace the company's board.

* Moderna shares were up after vaccine experts advising the FDA voted, 19-0, to recommend authorization of an extra dose of its Covid-19 shot.

* Aluminum maker Alcoa reported a 31% rise in sales for its latest quarter, even as shipments fell, partly because of a lack of railcars.

* Bitcoin prices were up 3.9%, bringing it closer to $60,000, and crypto stocks Coinbase Global, Marathon Digital and BIT Mining rose were posting gains.

* Enterprise software company Duck Creek Technologies reported a net loss for the final quarter of its fiscal year.

Chart of the Day

* Shares of Petershill Partners, an investment vehicle managed by Goldman Sachs' asset-management arm, are down 9% since its initial public offering late last month. That is worse than both the broader market and peers.

Write to James Willhite at james.willhite@wsj.com

Virgin Galactic, Bitcoin, Moderna, Goldman: What to Watch in the Stock Market Today
